SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Most of your fellow cadets were already here, geared up and ready to go. The Grandmasters arrived soon after.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Well, Cadets! You've done exceptionally well in your training so far. Are you ready to put your skills to the test?
Ready or not, I guess we just have to do it.
We'll get it done. You can count on us Grandmasters.
Well then, you've all been briefed by Scottie. I trust you know what to do. Go with the Source, Cadets!
Before you all go though, I have a little parting gift.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: He starts handing out small, round glowing orbs.

POPUP.NARRATION: You can feel it pulsating with energy in your hands.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: What's this?
These are Source bombs. They are incredibly powerful. You'll need them in order to destroy the generator.
So, you kids ready?
Yep. Beam us over, Scottie!
What...? This place...
This is so disorienting...
How are we even suppose to find the generator in this maze?!

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Around you, the other cadets are looking similarly disoriented.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Ok, calm down and focus. We just have to remember what we did during training, and we'll be fine.
Right, ok. Where do we even begin?
Let's pick a spot and start from there. How about here?

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: Nothing happened.
This door is exactly like the other ??? doors in this room.
You take a moment to admire how shiny and spotless this door is. Some poor bot must spend its whole day wiping down the insides of this ship.
This is not the door you are looking for.
Nope.
Nothing happened. Frustrated, you kick the door with all the strength you could muster.
The light in the center of the door went out.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: I have a bad feeling about this.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: There was a few seconds of complete silence as everyone held their breath, waiting for the hammer to fall.
Nothing continued to happen.
You hobbled off on your now throbbing foot to try the rest of the doors.
Nothing happened.
To your horror, a synthetic voice, presumably belonging to the door, starts singing.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Daisy, Daisy, give me your answer do~

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: You hurriedly move on to the next door to avoid its terrible singing.
Nothing happened.
You nearly jump out of your skin when a synthetic voice speaks to you.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: State your business.
Um... We're looking for the generator room. Can you please open the door?
I'm sorry. I'm afraid I can't do that.
Why not?
You need a password.
Please note that presenting the wrong password will result in permanent incapacitation.
Um... Open sesame?

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The door slides open smoothly, revealing the generator room inside. Everyone heaved a sigh of relief.

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Wow, I can't believe that worked. I was absolutely certain we were gonna die back there.
Yeah, I know right.
Come on, let's plant the bomb and get out of here. This place is gonna make me puke.
Right, that should do it.
Let's signal Scottie to beam us out of here, then we can trigger the explosion.
Look's like that did it!
Now that the shields are down, the Order's fleet can blast it into oblivion!

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: The massive Death Cube began to wither under the constant barrage of attacks from the Crystal Order's fleet.

POPUP.NARRATION: The indestructible Death Cube was no match for the might of the Crystal Order's fleet!

DIALOGUE.SPEECH: Yes, we did it! We destroyed the Death Cube!
Well done, kids! You guys really saved the day! I knew we could count on you!
Yes, that was brilliantly done, Cadets! We couldn't have succeeded without you!
Indeed! You shall all receive a medal of the highest honour for your contributions.
Now, you should get some well deserved rest.

SEQUENCE.NARRATION: You head out of the Telebay with your fellow Cadets, tired but in high spirits.
On the way out, you noticed Grandmasters Hartin-Menz and Lok-Kim discussing something in low voices, with troubled looks on their faces.
You pushed the thought out of your mind for now, sleepiness taking over.
